timeline.message: feat: Implement action result with custom endpoints.
refactor: Fix the endpoints to use ActionResult.
refactor: Clean up some code smells.

timeline.bodyText: I think these methods could be shortened to a single return line
timeline.author: bamandel

timeline.bodyText: Ok implies 200 IMO, I would prefer we call this isSuccessful instead.
timeline.author: gkillough

timeline.bodyText: Would it be better to give ActionResult a method that would convert itself into a ResponseEntity? At least these basic conversions? Or is that making ActionResult do too much?
timeline.author: bamandel

replies.bodyText: I think that would be making ActionResult do too much.  We may want to convert it differently.
replies.author: psantos1113

timeline.bodyText: If we add the conversion to ActionResult, this could all be handled in a methodin ActionResult.
timeline.author: bamandel

timeline.bodyText: Why isn't this the content of ActionResult? It seems like it would probably be better to update ValidationResponseModel and make this ActionResult<ValidationResponseModel> instead.
timeline.author: gkillough

+package com.synopsys.integration.alert.common.action;
+
+import java.util.List;
+
+import org.springframework.http.HttpStatus;
+
+import com.synopsys.integration.alert.common.descriptor.config.field.errors.AlertFieldStatus;
+
+public class ValidationActionResult extends ActionResult<Void> {
+    private List<AlertFieldStatus> fieldStatusList;

timeline.bodyText: This code makes me think we still have a long way to go on this problem. Perhaps this is out of scope for this PR, but I think we should get rid of this class entirely and CustomEndpointManager. Instead, we should find a way to have an abstract controller that handles the explicit typing of responses. Then all of the custom endpoints that exist would not have the extra registration step, and could just extend that controller and implement a single abstract method while strongly typing the controller.
timeline.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: This is just the first step and low hanging fruit to start implementing and changing the code.  Ultimately what I would like is similar to what you suggest.  I'm simply starting the process.  I actually need to change the branch to the feature branch because I have a feature branch where these changes will go.
replies.author: psantos1113

replies.bodyText:
If the code is completely working, I would say skip the feature branch. I think we could all benefit from having the ActionResult object ASAP so that we don't need to add more tech-debt around this.
Then I think a fast-follow MR fixing custom endpoints would be beneficial.
replies.author: gkillough

timeline.bodyText: I think OAuthEndpointResponse also tracks a status code. We should either get rid of that, or pass it through to be converted to an HttpStatus.
timeline.author: gkillough

timeline.message: refactor: Updates based on PR feedback.
